segment.source: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer
segment.target: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer

segment.source: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer
segment.target: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer

segment.source: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer
segment.target: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the publishing server on a separate computer.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the publishing server on a separate computer.

segment.source: Before you perform the following procedure, ensure the database and management server are available.
segment.target: Before you perform the following procedure, ensure the database and management server are available.

segment.source: To install the publishing server on a separate computer
segment.target: To install the publishing server on a separate computer

segment.source: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.
segment.target: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.

segment.source: To start the App-V 5.1 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.
segment.target: To start the App-V 5.1 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.
segment.target: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.

segment.source: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).
segment.target: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).

segment.source: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.
segment.target: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Feature Selection page, select the Publishing Server checkbox and click Next.
segment.target: On the Feature Selection page, select the Publishing Server checkbox and click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.
segment.target: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Publishing Server Configuration page, specify the following items:
segment.target: On the Configure Publishing Server Configuration page, specify the following items:

segment.source: The URL for the management service that the publishing server will connect to.
segment.target: The URL for the management service that the publishing server will connect to.

segment.source: For example, http://ManagementServerName:12345.
segment.target: For example, http://ManagementServerName:12345.

segment.source: Specify the website name that you want to use for the publishing service.
segment.target: Specify the website name that you want to use for the publishing service.

segment.source: Accept the default if you do not have a custom name.
segment.target: Accept the default if you do not have a custom name.

segment.source: For the Port Binding, specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V 5.1, for example 54321.
segment.target: For the Port Binding, specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V 5.1, for example 54321.

segment.source: On the Ready to Install page, click Install.
segment.target: On the Ready to Install page, click Install.

segment.source: After the installation is complete, the publishing server must be registered with the management server.
segment.target: After the installation is complete, the publishing server must be registered with the management server.

segment.source: In the App-V 5.1 management console, use the following steps to register the server:
segment.target: In the App-V 5.1 management console, use the following steps to register the server:

segment.source: Open the App-V 5.1 management server console.
segment.target: Open the App-V 5.1 management server console.

segment.source: In the left pane, select Servers, and then select Register New Server.
segment.target: In the left pane, select Servers, and then select Register New Server.

segment.source: Type the name of this server and a description (if required) and click Add.
segment.target: Type the name of this server and a description (if required) and click Add.

segment.source: To verify if the publishing server is running correctly, you should import a package to the management server, entitle the package to an AD group, and publish the package.
segment.target: To verify if the publishing server is running correctly, you should import a package to the management server, entitle the package to an AD group, and publish the package.

segment.source: Using an internet browser, open the following URL: http://publishingserver:pubport.
segment.target: Using an internet browser, open the following URL: http://publishingserver:pubport.

segment.source: If the server is running correctly information similar to the following will be displayed:
segment.target: If the server is running correctly information similar to the following will be displayed:

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got an App-V issue?
segment.target: Got an App-V issue?

segment.source: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
